messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: spanking implements????
messages.msgSnippet: ... Teaching Home, I m pretty sure. http://www.teachinghome.com/ I *think* someone mentioned they were having problems fulfilling their subscriptions. Any
messages.messageBody:
on 3/21/02 3:22 PM, alaurashome at alaurashome@... wrote:

> Would you mind saying which magazine this is? [with the rod advertisements]

Teaching Home, I'm pretty sure.

http://www.teachinghome.com/

I *think* someone mentioned they were having problems fulfilling their
subscriptions.

Any affiliation with Ezzo, Fulgate, Perls should set off alarm bells. As
should HSLDA.

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: spanking implements????
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/21/02 1:24:26 PM, alaurashome@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/21/02 1:24:26 PM, alaurashome@... writes:

<< Would you mind saying which magazine this is? I was just
considering treating myself to a homeschooling magazine
subscription. It has been so long since I have read any and I
definitely don't want this one! >>

If you're going to buy one aimed at the Christian Homeschooling Community,
you might get that one or worse!!

If you get Home Education Magazine, you will NOT get articles on corporal
punishment.

Sandra

certain sizes
> for certain ages, then you're objecting to my statement without
sufficient

homeschooling

Alaura

messages.subject: spanking implements????
messages.msgSnippet: -=-[Unschooling-dotcom] was  Andrea Yates now SANDRA-=- No, that s now how the list needs to be.  I m not the topic. The subject matter is.
messages.messageBody:
-=-[Unschooling-dotcom] was Andrea Yates now SANDRA-=-

No, that's now how the list needs to be. I'm not the topic. The subject
matter is.

<< Maybe we should NOT make blanket statements about others that we have no
REAL intimate knowledge of. >>

If the statement didn't apply to you, then it didn't.

I grew up Baptist.
I've probably read more of the Christian homeschooling literature than most
Christian homeschoolers have read. What would "intimate knowledge" look like?

If you yourself are unaware that there are dowels for sale in certain sizes
for certain ages, then you're objecting to my statement without sufficient
knowledge to discuss it. But the publisher of one large homeschooling
magazine recommends wooden spoons instead.

You didn't think I was making this stuff up, did you?

And all in all, were you defending Andrea Yates?
Attacking me?

I hope neither.

Sandra
